intro.title: What is Performance Engineering?
paragraphs: Performance Engineering is a discipline within systems engineering that focuses on ensuring a system will meet or exceed its performance requirements. It's not just about testing; it's a proactive process integrated throughout the entire software development lifecycle.
This hub is a collection of my notes, case studies, and thoughts on key concepts, tools, and methodologies in the world of performance.

items.name: Latency & Response Time
items.description: The time taken for a single transaction to be processed.

items.name: Throughput
items.description: The number of transactions a system can handle per unit of time (e.g., requests/second).

items.name: Scalability
items.description: The ability of a system to handle a growing amount of work by adding resources.

items.name: Capacity Planning
items.description: The process of determining the production capacity needed by an organization to meet changing demands for its products.

items.name: Workload Modelling
